label: def-reward-measurement
full_text:
The reward value $r_i$ for walker $i$ at position $x_i$ is the result of integrating the global Reward Function $R$ against the walker's positional measure, which is the Dirac delta measure $\delta_{x_i}$ on $\mathcal{X}$. This formalizes the act of 'evaluating the reward' as a measurement process.

$$
r_i := \mathbb{E}_{\delta_{x_i}}[R] = \int_{\mathcal{X}} R(x) \, d\delta_{x_i}(x) = R(x_i)
$$
